table_with_only_examples:
{| class="wikitable "
! Name
!Image
! Neighborhood
! Borough
! Type
! Summary
|-
| [[Academy of Arts, Berlin]] 
|[[File:Akademie der Künste Berlin.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| [[Friedrichstadt (Berlin)|Friedrichstadt]] || Mitte  || Art || Located in [[Pariser Platz]], offers exhibitions, concerts, debates, readings, film, theatre, and dance performances
|-
| [[AG Märkische Kleinbahn]] 
|[[File:Mkb bfsow.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]||[[Lichterfelde (Berlin)|Lichterfelde]] || [[Steglitz-Zehlendorf]] || Railway || Railway vehicles, exhibits about the history of Zehlendorfer Railway
|-
| [[Allied Museum]] 
|[[File:Berlin Clayallee AlliiertenMuseum UAV 04-2017.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]||[[Dahlem (Berlin)|Dahlem]] ||Steglitz-Zehlendorf  || History ||  Cold War history and roles of the Western Allies (US, France and Britain) in Germany between 1945 and 1994 and their contribution to liberty in Berlin
|-
| [[Alte Nationalgalerie]]
|[[File:AlteNationalgalerie 1a.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| [[Museum Island]]  || [[Mitte]] || Art || Part of the [[Berlin State Museums]], gallery showing a collection of [[Neoclassicism#Painting and printmaking|Neoclassical]], [[Romanticism#Romantic visual arts|Romantic]], [[Biedermeier#Visual arts|Biedermeier]], [[Impressionism|Impressionist]] and early [[Modernism|Modernist]] artwork
|-
| [[Altes Museum]] 
|[[File:Altes Museum (Berlin) (6339770591).jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| Museum Island || Mitte || Art || Part of the Berlin State Museums, features antiquities - art and culture of the Ancient Greeks, Etruscans, and Romans |}

| [[File:Berlin, Tierarzneischule, Anatomisches Theater, Langhans, Seitenansicht.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| Mitte || Mitte || Medical || Part of the [[Humboldt University of Berlin]], historic teaching auditorium for the veterinary school
|-
| Anna Seghers Museum 
| [[File:Adlershof Anna-Seghers-Gedenkstätte.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| [[Adlershof]] || Treptow-Köpenick || Biographical || [http://www.adk.de/en/archive/memorial-centres/annaseghers-memorial-centres.htm Website], rooms where author [[Anna Seghers]] lived, operated by the Academy of Arts, Berlin Archive
|-
| {{Interlanguage link|Anti-War Museum|de|Anti-Kriegs-Museum}}
| [[File:Anti Kriegs Museum Berlin.jpg|frameless|167x167px]]|| [[Wedding (Berlin)|Wedding]] || Mitte || History || [http://www.anti-kriegs-museum.de/ Website], facts on the topics of war and peace, and features an original air raid shelter from World War II, weapons, war toys, peace movement
|-
|BcmA Berlin
|[[File:Schermafbeelding-2014-04-28-om-17.33.19.webp|frameless|125x125px]]
|[[Kreuzberg]]
|[[Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg]]
|Art
|[https://bcma.gallery BcmA Berlin] is a non-profit cultural and artistic platform for artists in Berlin to present and create new ideas in a highly collaborative project space. |}

{| class="wikitable "
! Name
!Image
! Neighborhood
! Borough
! Type
! Summary
|-
| {{Interlanguage link|Berlin Energy Museum|de|Energie-Museum Berlin}}
| [[File:Berlin-Lankwitz Energie-Museum.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]||[[Steglitz]] || Steglitz-Zehlendorf || Technology || [http://www.energie-museum.de/ Website], development of energy generation and supply systems, located in a former power plant
|-
| {{Interlanguage link|Berlin Museum of Medical History at the Charité|de|Berliner Medizinhistorisches Museum}}
|[[File:Berliner Medizinhistorisches Museum.JPG|frameless|125x125px]]|| Mitte || Mitte || Medical || [http://bmm-charite.de/ Website], developments in medicine including the view of and into the body, patients, today’s medicine, pathological-anatomical specimens, microscopes, medical instruments; formerly the Pathology Museum of Rudolf Virchow
|-
| Berlin Story Museum 
| || [[Kreuzberg]] || [[Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg]] || History || [https://www.berlinstory.de/english-2/ Website], photos and artifacts about the city's history
|-
| {{Interlanguage link|Berlin Underworlds Museum|de|Berliner Unterwelten}}
| [[File:U-Bahnhof Gesundbrunnen - Eingang mit Schriftzug und Logo 'Berliner Unterwelten e.V.'.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| [[Gesundbrunnen (Berlin)|Gesundbrunnen]] || Mitte || History || [https://www.berliner-unterwelten.de/en/index.html Website], history and tours of the city's underground systems including the bunker systems in Berlin’s subway system, recovered bombs and ammunition stores, Berlin’s pneumatic post system, breweries and blind tunnels
|-
| {{Interlanguage link|Berlin U-Bahn Museum|de|Berliner U-Bahn-Museum}}
|[[File:Berlin U-bahn Museum Eingang.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| [[Westend (Berlin)|Westend]] || Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf || Transportation || [https://www.ag-berliner-u-bahn.de/index.php/museum Website], history of the city's subway system, located in the historical signal tower at the [[Berlin Olympiastadion station]]
|-
| {{Interlanguage link|Berliner DDR-Motorradmuseum|de|DDR Museum: Motorrad}}
|[[File:DDR Museum- Motorrad.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| Mitte || Mitte || Transportation || [http://www.erstesberliner-ddr-motorradmuseum.de/ Website], over 140 motorcycles, scooters and mopeds from East German manufacturers |}

| [[File:Luetzowplatz.9.jpg|frameless|125x125px]]|| Tiergarten || Mitte || Art || [http://www.hausamluetzowplatz-berlin.de/ Website], hosts six to eight exhibitions of national and international contemporary artists in all media |}

| || [[Hellersdorf]] || [[Marzahn-Hellersdorf]] || Historic house || [https://web.archive.org/web/20150629180635/http://www.stadtundland.de/125_Museumswohnung.htm Website], typical East German apartment with all furnishings made in East Germany
